commit 46654b170fec9747b64a6ad3a9b594170cfeec65
Author: Sergey Nikitin <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Feb 25 15:00:57 2015 +0300

    Fixed incorrect behavior of method sqlalchemy.api._check_instance_exists
    
    This method must raise InstanceNotFound exception if there is no instance
    with specified UUID. But it raises exception ONLY if we have no instances
    at all. It happens because filter with UUID in sqlalchemy query was missed
    
    Added missed filter
    
    This method is used only in instance tags CRUD operations.
    To check that InstanceNotFound exception will be raised if we try
    to create/delete/update tag of non existent instance we just didn't create
    instance at all. So instance tags tests were "green" because exception
    is raised ONLY if we have no instances at all.
    
    So to check that this bug is fixed we can just create some instances
    in test_instance_tag_***_non_existing_instance tests.
    Also method sqlalchemy.api._check_instance_exists is
    private so we can't check it directly.
    
    Closes-Bug: #1425485
    
    Change-Id: I45834d04cd6ddd9e859f91a163f6b0f616106bb9
